Mayor's Page

Mayor Dan Davis: A Visionary Leader Committed to Manvel’s Future

Elected as the youngest City Councilmember in Manvel’s history (2019-2022), I quickly built a reputation for challenging the status quo, cutting through bureaucracy, and putting people before politics. In 2023, I was elected Mayor with 64% of the vote, becoming one of the youngest mayors in America. My leadership is centered on transparency, trust, and bold decision-making that moves the city forward.

As Mayor, I have championed policies that empower residents and businesses alike. Under my leadership, Manvel has: ✅ Renegotiated development agreements to prioritize the needs of the community. ✅ Cut burdensome regulations that stifled economic growth and investment. ✅ Secured Manvel’s first grocery store—HEB, improving local access to essential goods. ✅ Reduced unnecessary costs for residents, including establishing the first-ever Homestead Exemption. ✅ Rewrote city policies, strengthening fiscal responsibility, preparing for the future, and putting people first.

I am not just leading Manvel—I am building a legacy of trust, innovation, and progress. My mission is clear: a government that listens, a city that thrives, and a future that works for everyone.

Board Member - The Yellow Out Campaign Board Member - ActionS, Inc. Former Board Member - Alvin Manvel Area Chamber of Commerce Former Board Member - American Cities Counties Exchange Alvin ISD YET Mentor Rotarian - Alvin Sunrise Rotary Club Member - Alvin-Manvel Chamber of Commerce

The Manvel State of the City was held this year at the Church on MastersRoad on November 13, 2024. View the State of the City presentation (PDF) or watch the recording of the State of the City Address :

  1. City of Manvel Receives Superior Public Water System Designation from TCEQ

    Manvel administrative offices will be closed on Monday, January 19, 2026, in observance of Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Read on...
